abstract: Apollo Global Management, the private equity firm led by Leon D. Black, said on Monday that it was seeking a $50 million initial public offering of shares as it seeks to migrate to the New York Stock Exchange from Goldman Sachs’s private market.
snippet: Apollo Global Management, the private equity firm led by Leon D. Black, said on Monday that it was seeking a $50 million initial public offering of shares as it seeks to migrate to the New York Stock Exchange from Goldman Sachs’s private market.
lead_paragraph: Apollo Global Management, the private equity firm led by Leon D. Black, said on Monday that it was seeking a $50 million initial public offering of shares as it aims to migrate to the New York Stock Exchange from Goldman Sachs‘s private market.

headline.main: Apollo Seeks $50 Million Offering on N.Y.S.E.
